Summary I am currently working as a research engineer at the Yahoo Research Labs in Haifa, Israel. I completed my BSc and M.Sc degrees at the Computer Science Department at the Technion, Haifa - Israel Institute of Technology. I have conducted research under the supervision of Prof. Shaul Markovitch in the LARA (Learning and Reasoning) laboratory. My main research interests cover Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Natural Language Processing. I also worked as a student software developer at Zoran Microelectronics, Haifa, and as a summer intern and research engineer at IBM Research Labs, Haifa. 
 
Specialties: Programming languages: C/C++, C#, Java, Python. 
Development tools: Visual Studio, Eclipse. 
Programming experience: GUI programming, Concurrent and Distributed Programming, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing. Labs August 2010  –  June 2012  (1 year 11 months) Santa Clara, CA I involve in multiple research projects at Yahoo!, and use technologies of Data Mining, Machine Learning, User Understanding, Anti-Abuse, Social Networks, and Hadoop on massive datasets.  
 
- Anti-Fraud: developed advanced machin learned anti-fraud models which help a major Asian E-commerce website to reduce the fraud rate of by 50% and reduce spending on a buyer protection program by 70%. We published 2 academic papers in CIKM and WWW. We also won a Yahoo! superstar team award, which is the highest achievement in the company. 
 
- User reputation and expertise: developed user reputation and expertise models which helps many Yahoo! properties to find the valuable contributors and fight the spammers and abusers. We published 1 paper in KDD and 1 paper in SIGIR. 
 
- Customer engagement and segmentation: why some users get more engaged and the other are less engaged? How to analyze their pattern and predict their future engagement? What is the reason for the change? I study those problem based on massive user activity data and build engagement and segmentation model to answer those questions. 
 
- Social networks and influence inferring: people share articles to their friends on social channels like Facebook, Twitter. I study the problem how to find the influential users and construct the affective social networks and interests networks based on the user interaction data. Summary I lead the science team responsible for maintaining and enriching the Yahoo Knowledge Graph, a large unified knowledge graph that provides rich information about entities and powers a wide variety of entity-based services at Yahoo. 
 
My background is in computer science and knowledge engineering and my present interests include information extraction, information integration, knowledge management, knowledge representation, data mining, machine learning, data visualization, and semantic search. 
 
I held several other R&D positions at startups and large organizations, including research engineer at Yahoo Labs, Web search engineer at Yahoo, team lead at Kelkoo, teaching and research assistant at the University of Rennes, and research engineer at Orange Labs. Experience Senior Science Manager Yahoo Labs June 2015  – Present (3 months) Sunnyvale, California Managing the "Knowledge Management" team @ Yahoo Labs. 
Science lead for the Yahoo Knowledge Graph. 
 
- Information Extraction and Information Integration 
- Knowledge Management and Knowledge Engineering 
- Data Mining and Machine Learning 
- Semantic Search Principal Research Engineer Yahoo Labs March 2013  –  June 2015  (2 years 4 months) San Francisco Bay Area Science Lead for the Yahoo Knowledge Graph 
 
- Information extraction from heterogeneous data sources on the Web 
- Ontology alignment, schema mapping, and data normalization 
- Integration and knowledge management: e.g. entity deduplication, fusion, type inference 
- Knowledge representation: i.e. ontology for organizing and representing entities in the graph 
- Semantic Search: e.g. graph search, object ranking 
 
Note that Data Mining and/or Machine Learning are used in most of the above tasks... 
 
Env.: Linux, Hadoop/Pig/Java, Spark/Scala, Python, Git, Protege, Graph databases, ... Senior Research Engineer Yahoo Labs January 2009  –  March 2013  (4 years 3 months) San Francisco Bay Area Involved in several Information Extraction and Knowledge Management projects for Yahoo. 
 
1) Information Extraction 
Designed and implemented a system that continuously extracted and normalized entities and relationships from Wikipedia and misc. data sources on the Web. Resulting entity-relationship graph (7M entities ; 450M relationships) powered semantic search and content analysis projects at Yahoo. 
 
2) Knowledge Representation and Knowledge Engineering 
Key contributor to the WOO ontology, a large OWL ontology for representing information about entities at Yahoo. Also designed an ETL system based on XML/XSLT for doing large-scale schema mapping and data normalization in a distributed fashion, declaratively. 
 
3) Information Integration and Knowledge Management 
Contributed to WOO, a large-scale information integration platform for deduping entities coming from several sources, and drove the Yahoo Knowledge Base project, which used WOO to build the first centralized knowledge base of all the entities and relationships we cared about at Yahoo. 
 
4) Semantic Search  
Developed graph mining algorithms and systems to add Semantic Search capabilities to Yahoo Search (e.g. faceted search, related entities, etc.) 
 
5) Text Mining 
Developed a system for extracting and ranking interesting snippets from user-generated reviews  
 
Env: Linux, Hadoop, MapReduce, Pig, Python, Java, SVN, MySQL, Protege, Open Refine, ... Web Search Engineer Yahoo July 2007  –  January 2009  (1 year 7 months) France EU Search Innovation team 
Information Extraction, Web Search, Web/Graph Mining, Content Analysis 
 
Developed a system for extracting and normalizing entities and relationships from feeds and structured data on the Web. This system enriched several dictionaries and knowledge bases within Yahoo! Search, which were used for Content Analysis and Query Interpretation. 
 
Worked on a knowledge-based system that automatically builds large semantic graphs from feeds and Web Search results using Web Mining techniques. Also worked on mining and ranking these semantic graphs for categorizing terms and finding related terms. This system was used on Yahoo! Sport, and has been evaluated on Yahoo! Search and Yahoo! Answers. 
 
Led the refactoring of a content analysis system that performs key term extraction from Web documents and returns weighted term vectors. Also worked on enriching the results of this system with related terms coming from the knowledge-based search system we developed. 
 
Env.: Linux, Python, C/C++, Perl, relational and graph databases, search platforms, CVS Senior Software Engineer Kelkoo April 2005  –  July 2007  (2 years 4 months) France Shopping Comparison Search Engine platform & website 
Offer & product listings. Feed acquisition, integration, indexing, ranking, search and serving 
 
Technical Lead for the Channel Management project, a white-brand hosted platform providing custom Shopping Comparison capabilities to customers such as HP. Supervised a team of 4 persons, EMEA/APAC, 24/7. 
 
Led the refactoring of the new platform, designed new features on backend and frontend sides, technical support and troubleshooting on the whole platform. 
 
Main developer for the backend platform in charge of retrieving, normalizing, integrating and indexing heterogeneous offer and product listings from resellers and manufacturers. 
 
Env.: Linux, Perl, Java/J2EE, MySQL, Apache/Tomcat, XML. Full time Research and Teaching Assistant University of Rennes 2002  –  2004  (2 years) France Teaching Assistant at ENSSAT: 
Lectures, tutorials, labs and projects (up to the M.Sc degree) in Algorithms (introduction, advanced, data structures), Systems (operating systems, system programming, distributed systems), Databases (RDBMS) and Artificial Intelligence (machine learning, planning).  
 
Env.: Unix/Linux, Shell, C ANSI, Java, Oracle, Ada, Prolog.  
 
Research Assistant at IRISA. 
Studied the specifics of Computer-Mediated Communications, and developed Natural Language Processing resources and tools for normalizing non-standard words, and segmenting, tokenizing, tagging and chunking emails and newsgroup messages. 
 
Env.: C, Python, R, XML, Shell, Unix. Research Engineer Orange Labs - France Télécom R&D 1999  –  2002  (3 years) France Applied-research in Natural Language Processing for Text-To-Speech synthesis. 
=> Focus on robust/adaptive NLP for Email-To-Speech applications. 
 
Developed a corpus acquisition and annotation framework for building linguistically annotated corpora, automatically and incrementally: TEI/CES encoding, segmentation, tokenization, NSW normalization, stemming, POS tagging, chunking, parsing.  
 
Built linguistically annotated corpora for different types of computer-mediated communications: newsgroups, emails, instant messaging and SMS. Worked with linguists to manually review and further annotate these corpora.  
 
Conducted Corpus Linguistics studies on the specifics of Computer-Mediated Communications compared to standard written communications, especially from the Linguistics and Natural Language Processing point of views.  
 
Built resources and models based on expert knowledge (rule-based systems) and Machine Learning (CART, HMM, TBL) for normalizing non-standard words and segmenting, tokenizing, tagging and chunking emails and newsgroup messages.

In academics, mainly worked on Social networks and Game Theory to analyze the incentive structure in networks (both simulation and experimental).
